adrFormatAddress: 1535 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text: I have tried the French crème doughnuts and they are amazing. Well not they but the vanilla I enjoyed more then the pumpkin. It’s decadent;rich;robust; and delectable. I want to try more of the pastries if they will be as tasty as the two I have tried. The customer service is attentive. The bakery is quiet and serene. I am impressed to say the least. Eat well my friends.

text.text: I have tried the French crème doughnuts and they are amazing. Well not they but the vanilla I enjoyed more then the pumpkin. It’s decadent;rich;robust; and delectable. I want to try more of the pastries if they will be as tasty as the two I have tried. The customer service is attentive. The bakery is quiet and serene. I am impressed to say the least. Eat well my friends.

originalText.text: I tried two of their cakes ($3.00 each), one was their mini banana/chocolate cake and the other was their mini carrot cake. I felt that both had little to no flavor of the main stated ingredient. The only easily noticeable taste on either of the two was the topping, which was the chocolate, placed on the banana cake. See my photographs showing both of the mini cakes I bought. Their lentil soup ($9.00 for a large bowl, $7 for a small bowl) has tasted best around noon, rather than later in the day. The bread that comes with the soup can include whole wheat, if requested. For the bread, they also offer some complimentary interesting spreads. They include an organic Belgian dark chocolate spread; organic Belgian hazelnut spread; blueberry jam as well as apricot jam. I like to have their lentil soup on weekdays, when their regular chef is most likely there. There are differing opinions about the food reported in the reviews below, notice that some of them are a year old.

originalText.text: Great food and great service. My family and I stopped in last Sunday when it was busy but were still promptly served and greeted by our server, Breanne. She was sweet and accommodating, lugging a big high chair across the room for our son. While we were in a hurry, she gave us great recommendations.  The kiddos loved the mini pancakes, my husband had a freshly baked croissant which he said was delicious and got seconds. Overall great service and food and props to our server, will definitely be back.

Overall great service and food and props to our server, will definitely be back.

originalText.text:
The pastries looked amazing and tasted even better. We tried a variety of pastries, and every single one was incredible. Our favorites were the lemon and mixed berry tarts and the banana bread. We also ordered the vanilla chai latte, which was delicious and flavorful. The prices also seemed quite reasonable.
Sasha helped us, she was super polite and good at recommending the pastries :D Will definitely come again :)

text.text:

Sasha helped us, she was super polite and good at recommending the pastries :D Will definitely come again :)

originalText.text:
Love this place.

Upon walking in, you immediately smell the baked goods. The place always looks very clean and neat which i appreciate. The lines at the registers are always long and typically go fast.

Food is exceptional but the ambience is stale. We ordered pumpkin doughnut which was deliciously light and airy. There are also a lot of pastry options. There is also plenty of seating if you just need a place to sit and rest for a few minutes.
The prices here are pretty reasonable. Everything in NYC is expensive nowadays so it’s good to not see all the pastries priced at $10.
They also have drinks here, salads, sandwiches (both bkft and lunch).
I was helped by Sasha but you can ask any of the staff members about breakfast/lunch/dinner options, everyone is very nice and polite.

I really like this place and plan on continuing to visit!
